Did you know that recycled copper never loses its quality? 

Yep, that‚Äôs right! Copper can be recycled repeatedly without losing its strength or conductivity. These bales (thanks to our Sierra¬Æ REB-2 üòâ) are on their way to becoming part of items we use every day‚Äî

‚ö° Power cables and electrical wiring

üíª Circuit boards in computers, phones, and appliances

üîß Motors and transformers

üö∞ Copper pipes and fittings for plumbing

üè† Roofing materials and gutters

üèõÔ∏è Architectural elements like decorative panels

üöó Automotive wiring and radiators

üîã Electric vehicle batteries and charging stations

‚úàÔ∏è Components in airplanes and trains

üç≥ Cookware, such as copper pots and pans

üñºÔ∏è Decorative items like vases, sculptures, and picture frames

ü™ô Coins (many contain a mix of copper and other metals)

üå¨Ô∏è Wind turbine wiring

‚òÄÔ∏è Solar panel components

‚ùÑÔ∏è Energy-efficient HVAC systems

Clearly, recycled copper plays a vital role in our everyday lives! 

#copper #recycling #recycledmaterials #recycledcommodoties #recyclingisvital
